p: In relation to the Mediterranean EU27 countries, the internal emissions distribution among countries is considered as follows: for the emissions that fall under the EU Emissions Trading System (EU ETS), it is assumed that the overall target coincides with each country’s target (43% of ETS reduction in 2030 with respect to 2005); and for the sectors that fall outside the scope of the EU ETS, the distribution among countries of the binding annual GHG reductions is considered (European Parliament 2018). Then, the overall mitigation target for every country is determined using both contributions (EU ETS and non-EU ETS).1
